parameter-group.name: system
parameter-group.label: System Behavior
parameter-group.description: This group defines Python's system behavior.

parameter.name: helperModules
parameter.label: Activate openHAB Python helper moduleInject scope and helper objects into rules (requires helper modules)
parameter.description:
Install openHAB Python helper module to support helper classes like rule, logger, Registry, Timer, etc.
and automatically injects `from openhab import rule, Reistry, logger` into you python code.

options.option: Auto injection enabled for all scripts
Auto injection enabled only for UI and Transformation scripts (preferred)
Auto injection disabled and use manual 'import' statements instead
Disable helper module and use pure graalpy environment

parameter.name: pipModules
parameter.label: Python pip modules (requires a manually configured venv)
parameter.description: A comma separated list of Python modules to install. Versions may be constrained by separating with an == followed by standard python pip version constraint, such as "tzdata==2025.2".

parameter.name: dependencyTrackingEnabled
parameter.label: Enable dependency tracking
parameter.description: Dependency tracking allows your scripts to automatically reload when one of its dependencies is updated. You may want to disable dependency tracking if you plan on editing or updating a shared library, but don't want all your scripts to reload until you can test it.

parameter.name: cachingEnabled
parameter.label: Cache compiled openHAB Python modules (.pyc files)
parameter.description:
Cache the openHAB python modules for improved startup performance.
Disabling this option will result in slower startup performance, because scripts have to be recompiled on every startup.

parameter.name: jythonEmulation
parameter.label: Enable Jython emulation
parameter.description: This enables Jython emulation in GraalPy. It is strongly recommended to update code to GraalPy and Python 3 as the emulation can have performance degradation. For tips and instructions, please refer to Jython Migration Guide.
